qas.question: When did Boko Haram become active in Nigeria?
Who is the President of Nigeria?
How many people had Boko Haram killed by May 2014?
How many schoolgirls did Boko Haram kidnap?

context: Since <a0_0>2002<a0_0/>, the North East of the country has seen sectarian violence by Boko Haram, an Islamist movement that seeks to abolish the secular system of government and establish Sharia law. Nigerian President <a1_0>Goodluck Jonathan<a1_0/> in May 2014 claimed that Boko Haram attacks have left <a2_0>at least 12,000<a2_0/> people dead and 8,000 people crippled. At the same time, neighbouring countries, Benin, Chad, Cameroon and Niger joined Nigeria in a united effort to combat Boko Haram in the aftermath of a world media highlighted kidnapping of <a3_0>276<a3_0/> schoolgirls and the spread of Boko Haram attacks to these countries.
